causes: Dutch desire to consolidate control over the East Indies.
Internal conflicts between the ruling Balinese elite and the Sasak people.
Dutch intervention justified as protecting Sasak rebels against Balinese rule.
events_leading_up_to_war: The Sasak people rebelled against the Balinese rulers of Lombok and sought Dutch assistance.
The Dutch, seeing an opportunity, launched a military expedition.
Negotiations failed, leading to an all-out invasion.

result.treaty: Dutch annexation of Lombok into the Dutch East Indies.
result.territorial_changes: Lombok incorporated into the Dutch colonial system.

Netherlands.ships: Several warships including HNLMS Koningin Emma

Balinese_Kingdom_of_Lombok.weapons: Traditional kris daggers, spears, and some firearms

major_battles.name: Siege of Mataram
major_battles.description: Dutch forces besieged and bombarded the Balinese stronghold of Mataram, forcing its surrender.
major_battles.outcome: Dutch victory, major casualties among Balinese forces.

texts.name: Dutch Military Reports
texts.details: Detailed accounts of the Dutch campaign and logistical reports.

texts.name: Balinese Court Records
texts.details: Records detailing resistance efforts and communication among Balinese leaders.

archaeological_evidence.description: Cannon fragments and bullets found in battle sites around Mataram.
Kris daggers and traditional armor from fallen warriors.

historical_texts.name: Dutch Colonial Accounts
historical_texts.details: Eyewitness accounts from Dutch officers describing the conflict and aftermath.

political: The Dutch established full control over Lombok.
The Balinese elite in Lombok were removed or forced into submission.
long_term_effects: Further Dutch expansion in Indonesia, solidifying colonial rule.
Loss of indigenous governance in Lombok for decades.

military: Highlighted resistance strategies of Southeast Asian kingdoms.
political: Marked a turning point in the consolidation of Dutch rule over Indonesia.
Demonstrated the role of indigenous factions (Sasak rebels) in colonial conquests.
cultural: Symbolized the fall of indigenous Balinese rule in Lombok.
Balinese resistance stories became part of regional folklore.
